title: Tension in strings connecting three blocks

content.question: Blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of equal mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are on a horizontal surface of negligible friction and are connected by light strings. The blocks are moving at constant speed, and the tensions <math alttext="T sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="T sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are equal to zero. The blocks are then being accelerated to the right by a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure. The tensions in the strings connecting the blocks are <math alttext="T sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="T sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives correct equations for the two tensions?
